ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Shall man then have whatever he covets?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Can ever man get what he desires?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Does man imagine that whatever he wishes for is right for him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Can the human being have whatever he wishes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: What! Will man get whatever he dreams of?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or shall man have what he wishes
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or shall man have what he wishes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Or shall man have whatever he fancies?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or shall man have what he coveteth?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Shall man have whatever he craves?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Shall man have whatsoever he wisheth for!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Shall man have whatever he yearns for?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay, shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or shall man have what he wishes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Is the human to have whatever he fancies?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or is the human being to have whatever he desires?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:24] Or shall man, that is, shall every human being among them, have whatever he wishes for?, such as [their wish] that the idols intercede for them. [No!] It is not so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or shall man) the people of Mecca (have what he coveteth) i.e. that the idols and angels will intercede for them?
